result.execSummary:
The defendant Lanail Antonio Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Witness/Person Charged/Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(7).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Extended Supervision and Probation conditions same

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs, assessments and fees including all mandatory surcharges in this action during period of probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Possess no firearms.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
No contact with the victim unless approved by the agent.

Complete a mental health assessment and comply with all recommended programming.
Successfully complete a Batterer's Intervention Program.
Absolute sobriety--no illegal drugs or alcohol.
Random urine screens.
Provide a DNA sample, if not already provided, and pay the DNA surcharge during probation.
Cooperate fully with probation agent.
AODA assessment and comply with treatment.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED, to be used until next court date of 9/5/14.
*** 11-7-14, Judge Dallet, Court ordered defendant to serve 3 days straight time, forthwith, with no good time credit, as condition time in the House of Correction for said defendant's non-compliance with the aforementioned condition of probation.***

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lanail Antonio Lee

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lanail Antonio Lee in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Lanail Antonio Lee in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Sarra M. Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 3 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lanail Antonio Lee in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lanail Antonio Lee in court with attorney Gregory A Renden.  Ryan T Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements made as to sentencing.
The Court sentenced defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT OF 4 YEARS, with credit for 37 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  
.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program; is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
.
Court IMPOSED BUT STAYED the Sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 3 years with the following conditions:
-Defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, STAYED, to be used until next court date.
-Complete a mental health assessment and comply with all recommended programing.
-Successfully complete a Batterer's Intervention Program.
-AODA assessment and comply with treatment.
-Absolute sobriety-no illegal drugs or alcohol.
-Random urine screens.
-No Contact with the victim unless approved by the agent.
-Possess no firearms.
-Cooperate fully with probation agent.
-Maintain full time employment.
-Pay all court costs, assessments and fees including all mandatory surcharges in this action during period of Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
.
Defendant ordered to provide a DNA sample, if not already provided, and pay the DNA surcharge during Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lanail Antonio Lee in court with attorney Gregory A Renden.  Defendant Lanail Antonio Lee in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for sentencing.  State was not able to comply with the victim notification statute.  Court ordered matter adjourned.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Reinstating Defendant's Telephone/Mail/Visitation Privileges signed and filed.

Defendant Lanail Antonio Lee in court with attorney Gregory A Renden.  Defendant Lanail Antonio Lee in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  The 7/14/14 jury trial is vacated.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-09-2014 at 01:30 p.m.  Jury trial scheduled for 07-14-2014 at 8:30 a.m.

Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Bail remains as previously set.  

Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing and jury trial in Branch 40.
Clerk:  jms

Defense counsel enters Speedy trial demand.

State's motion to join cases for purposes of trial granted by the Court.

Defendant Lanail Antonio Lee in court with attorney Gregory A Renden.  Defendant Lanail Antonio Lee in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.

Exhibit # 1 marked for identification.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  Milwaukee County District Attorney's Office Investigator Todd Armstrong.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised  case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.
Clerk:  jms
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Tomorrow R.

Defendant Lanail Antonio Lee in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Defendant Lanail Antonio Lee in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant withholds plea as to misdemeanor count 2 to preserve right to substitution of judge.
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
